title: Spack trying to create module for external package when it has been told not to

labels.name: snl-atdm
labels.description: Issues for SNL ATDM usage of spack

body:
CC: @fryeguy52 Tag: snl-atdm-issue Using the updated 0.13.0 version of spack, using the files:
spack.yaml ``` # Spack env file to build a compiler using Spack # # NOTE: Spack will not only read this file but will also write to it so make # sure you create a copy before spack uses it! # spack: # Packages to build (ordered mostly by dependencies) specs: [ gcc@7.2.0 , ] modules: tcl: hash_length: 0 naming_scheme: spack-${PACKAGE}/${VERSION} whitelist: - gcc blacklist: - '%' all: conflict: - '{name}' filter: environment_blacklist: [CPATH, LIBRARY_PATH] environment: set: ${PACKAGE}_ROOT: ${PREFIX} verbose: false packages: all: compiler: [] include: - packages_tools_for_compiler_build.yaml - common_options.yaml - preinstalled_packages.yaml ```
common_options.yaml ``` mirrors: local_filesystem: file:///ascldap/users/rabartl/Spack.base4/atdm-spack/atdm-spack-tarball-mirror config: misc_cache: .spack/cache ```
preinstalled_packages.yaml ``` packages: perl: buildable: False paths: perl@5.10.1 %gcc arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64: /usr perl@5.10.1 %gcc arch=linux-rhel6-core2: /usr autoconf: buildable: False paths: autoconf@2.63 %gcc arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64: /usr autoconf@2.63 %gcc arch=linux-rhel6-core2: /usr automake: buildable: False paths: automake@1.11.1 %gcc arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64: /usr automake@1.11.1 %gcc arch=linux-rhel6-core2: /usr m4: buildable: False paths: m4@1.4.13 %gcc arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64: /usr m4@1.4.13 %gcc arch=linux-rhel6-core2: /usr libtool: buildable: False paths: libtool@2.2.6b %gcc arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64: /usr libtool@2.2.6b %gcc arch=linux-rhel6-core2: /usr tar: buildable: False paths: tar@1.23 %gcc arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64: / tar@1.23 %gcc arch=linux-rhel6-core2: / diffutils: buildable: False paths: diffutils@2.8.1 %gcc arch=linux-rhel6-x86_64: /usr diffutils@2.8.1 %gcc arch=linux-rhel6-core2: /usr ```
atdm-spack/spack/etc/spack/modules.yaml ``` # This file is needed to stop spack from trying to generate dotkit modules for # external packages modules: enable:: - tcl ```
running: ``` $./atdm-spack/spack/bin/spack install ``` produces: ``` ==> Concretized gcc@7.2.0 - zzfkclh gcc@7.2.0%gcc@4.4.7~binutils languages=c,c++,fortran ~nvptx patches=51aebe82afc9a0433ca3503a36592edf5ca769b1433986919cfb9ae2ddf3e343 ~piclibs~strip arch=linux-rhel6-core2 - pbouq4g ^gmp@6.1.2%gcc@4.4.7 arch=linux-rhel6-core2 - egzrwwp ^autoconf@2.63%gcc@4.4.7 arch=linux-rhel6-core2 - j3qtjf4 ^automake@1.11.1%gcc@4.4.7 arch=linux-rhel6-core2 - 2uogxqf ^libtool@2.2.6b%gcc@4.4.7 arch=linux-rhel6-core2 - 2m4zmsg ^m4@1.4.13%gcc@4.4.7+sigsegv arch=linux-rhel6-core2 - nizawm4 ^isl@0.18%gcc@4.4.7 arch=linux-rhel6-core2 - ddtcqci ^libiconv@1.16%gcc@4.4.7 arch=linux-rhel6-core2 - giua3so ^mpc@1.1.0%gcc@4.4.7 arch=linux-rhel6-core2 - laq5nlz ^mpfr@3.1.6%gcc@4.4.7 patches=66a5d58364113a21405fc53f4a48f4e8 arch=linux-rhel6-core2 - 6phegih ^zlib@1.2.11%gcc@4.4.7+optimize+pic+shared arch=linux-rhel6-core2 ==> Updating view at /home/rabartl/Spack.base4/.spack-env/view ==> Installing environment /home/rabartl/Spack.base4 ==> autoconf@2.63 : externally installed in /usr ==> autoconf@2.63 : generating module file ==> Error: Unexpected end of input ``` The detailed output from: ``` $ ./atdm-spack/spack/bin/spack -d install --verbose ``` is given in:
Detailed install debug output ``` ==> [2019-10-30-18:03:13.374007] Reading config file /home/rabartl/Spack.base4/atdm-spack/spack/etc/spack/defaults/modules.yaml ==> [2019-10-30-18:03:13.382169]
